page.title: 01WYE VALLEY FROM THE BORDER
page.content: This area is divided by the A438 and river. It has navigational rights and is used for canoeing and the annual Raft Race. There is salmon, trout and coarse fishing. The Toll Bridge for light motor vehicles costs 20p return. Agriculturally consisting of three main farms: Brilley Court, Millhalf and Sheepcote (accommodating Golden Valley Hunt foxhounds). The two inns, 'Rhydspence' an old drover's inn and 'The Boat' beside the river, offer good food. Places of worship are St. Peter and St. Paul's Church with a weekly service, and Methodist Chapel at Brilley has an occasional service. Children travel to schools outside the area. A workshop makes gates and building needs. A small precision grinding factory employs local people. Most residents are retired. Those working travel daily to towns.
